title: Apply light pink and purple color scheme across entire app

requirements.summary: Update the global color scheme to use crisp white as the primary background color throughout the entire application
acceptanceCriteria: All pages and components use white as the default background color
Background color is consistent across all views

file_operations.description: Update the root background color variables to use crisp white (#ffffff) as the primary background. Replace any existing background color definitions in the :root and body selectors to ensure white is the default throughout the application.
Update the background color token in the theme.extend.colors section to define white as the default background color, ensuring consistency with the CSS variables.

requirements.summary: Update the color theme to use light pink as the primary accent color for UI elements including buttons, cards, borders, highlights, and interactive elements
acceptanceCriteria: Light pink is used as the dominant accent color throughout the UI
Buttons, cards, and interactive elements feature light pink styling
The color scheme is cohesive and appealing

file_operations.description: Define light pink color variables (e.g., --color-primary, --color-accent) in the :root selector using appropriate light pink shades (such as #FFC0CB, #FFB6C1, or similar). Update any existing primary/accent color definitions to use light pink values.

Add custom light pink color tokens to theme.extend.colors (e.g., primary, accent, pink) with appropriate shade variants (50-950) to support buttons, borders, backgrounds, and interactive states. Use light pink values like #FFC0CB, #FFB6C1 as the base shades.
Update the header styling to use light pink accent colors for interactive elements, borders, and highlights by replacing existing color classes with the new light pink theme tokens.
Update navigation cards and UI elements to use light pink for borders, backgrounds, and interactive states by replacing existing color classes with the new light pink theme tokens.
Update button styling and interactive elements to use light pink accent colors by replacing existing color classes with the new light pink theme tokens.
Update button styling and interactive elements on the login screen to use light pink accent colors by replacing existing color classes with the new light pink theme tokens.

requirements.summary: Add purple as a secondary accent color to complement light pink, creating visual appeal and hierarchy in the UI
acceptanceCriteria: Purple is used strategically as a secondary accent color
Light pink and purple work together harmoniously
Purple adds visual interest without overwhelming the light pink theme

file_operations.description: Define purple color variables (e.g., --color-secondary, --color-purple) in the :root selector using appropriate purple shades (such as #DDA0DD, #E6E6FA, or similar) that complement the light pink palette.

Add custom purple color tokens to theme.extend.colors (e.g., secondary, purple) with appropriate shade variants to support secondary UI elements, gradients, and visual hierarchy. Use purple values like #DDA0DD, #E6E6FA that harmonize with light pink.
Add purple accents to secondary UI elements such as navigation indicators, hover states, or decorative elements by incorporating the new purple theme tokens alongside the light pink primary colors.
Add purple accents to secondary elements such as card shadows, decorative borders, or background gradients to create visual hierarchy alongside the light pink primary colors.
Add purple accents to secondary UI elements or gradient overlays to complement the light pink primary colors and enhance visual appeal.

requirements.summary: Update the Tailwind theme configuration in tailwind.config.js to define light pink and purple color variables that can be used consistently across components
acceptanceCriteria: Custom color variables for light pink and purple are defined in Tailwind config
Color tokens are reusable across the application

file_operations.description: Define comprehensive color palettes in theme.extend.colors for both light pink (primary/accent/pink) and purple (secondary/purple) with full shade ranges (50, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 950). Ensure these tokens are designed for reusability across buttons, backgrounds, borders, text, and interactive states throughout the application.

requirements.summary: Update index.css theme variables to reflect the new light pink and purple color scheme, ensuring consistency with Tailwind configuration
acceptanceCriteria: CSS variables align with the new color scheme
Theme variables support the light pink and purple palette

file_operations.description: Update all color-related CSS custom properties in :root to use light pink and purple values that align with the Tailwind configuration. Ensure variables for background, foreground, primary, secondary, accent, border, and interactive states all reflect the new light pink and purple color scheme. Update both light and dark mode variables if present.

requirements.summary: Update all existing components to use the new light pink and purple color scheme, replacing current color references with the new theme tokens
acceptanceCriteria: All components render with the new color scheme
No remnants of the old color scheme remain visible
Visual consistency is maintained across all pages

file_operations.description: Update footer styling to use white background and light pink/purple accent colors for text and links by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update mood history list styling to use white background, light pink borders and accents, and purple secondary elements by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.

Update chat interface styling including message bubbles, input fields, and buttons to use white background with light pink and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.

Update chat room interface styling including room list, message containers, and send buttons to use white background with light pink primary and purple secondary colors by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.

Update private chat interface styling including thread list and message containers to use white background with light pink and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.

Update analytics dashboard styling including cards, charts, and data displays to use white background with light pink primary and purple secondary colors by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update app market settings interface styling to use white background with light pink buttons and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update access denied screen styling to use white background with light pink and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update logo component styling to complement the new light pink and purple color scheme if the logo uses theme colors.
Update presentation viewer interface styling to use white background with light pink and purple UI elements by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update dialog styling to use white background with light pink buttons and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update dialog styling to use white background with light pink primary and purple secondary colors by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update error state styling to use white background with light pink and purple accents by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update timeout fallback styling to use white background with light pink and purple UI elements by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
Update any app-level styling or container backgrounds to use the new white background with light pink and purple theme colors by replacing existing color classes with the new theme tokens.
